1.comment: Sorgi and Vince Young. I have so much to write about this contest, I don't even know where to start. OK, maybe not...    Peyton Manning played 1 drive and completed all of his passes. He was 7-of-7 for 95 yards and a touchdown. The yardage gave Manning his ninth consecutive 4,000-yard season - an NFL record.    Meanwhile, with his 7 receptions, Marvin Harrison moved past Cris Carter for second place on the all-time receptions list (Jerry Rice).    Dallas Clark was the only other Colts offensive player of note; he caught 6 passes for 59 yards. Reggie Wayne had 1 reception. Lance Ball led the team in rushing with 83 yards. Jim Sorgi was 22-of-30 but for just 178 yards.    As for the Titans,
